business.headline: WPI inflation stays negative in November despite food price uptickGovernment data released on Monday showed Wholesale Price Index (WPI) inflation at (-) 0.32% in November, compared with (-) 1.21% in October.
India's exports jump 19% in November, trade deficit hits 5-month lowThe US remained India's largest export destination from April to November 2025, despite the imposition of a 50% tariff.

Sensex, Nifty rebound to end marginally lower as FII outflow troubles marketThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 54.30 points to close at 85,213.36, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 19.65 points to end at 26,027.30.

SBI reduces lending rates, EMIs likely to drop: Check new home loan ratesWith several major banks already passing on the benefit, SBI's move will directly help customers whose loans are linked to different lending benchmarks.

Gold and silver at record highs. Should investors buy now or wait?Gold and silver prices are trading near record highs after a powerful rally this year. With both metals delivering strong returns, many investors are now wondering whether it still makes sense to buy or wait for a correction.

December 15 advance tax deadline is here: Who must pay and what happens if you don'tThe third advance tax instalment is due today, December 15. For many taxpayers, missing this deadline could mean mandatory interest and a larger payment at the time of filing returns.

Claimed tax refunds using fake donations? Here's what income tax department is doingIf you claimed tax benefits by showing donations that were never made, the Income Tax Department may already be watching. Authorities have launched a fresh drive to identify and correct such false claims.

4-day work week under new labour codes? Here's what Labour Ministry clarifiedOn November 21, 2025, the government replaced 29 old labour laws with four new Labour Codes and can Indians really work only four days a week and still get paid for a full week?

Hindustan Zinc shares may climb to Rs 660. Here's why Jefferies is bullishAccording to brokerage firm Jefferies, the Rs 660 target price suggests a potential upside of around 22%, including a dividend yield of about 4%.
Sensex opens 200 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; NTPC down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 394.84 points to 84,872.82, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 129.75 points to 25,917.20 as of 9:29 am.

Want to save tax? Here's how gifting mutual funds can help you with itA lesser-known method is gaining attention, gifting mutual fund units to relatives to legally reduce, or in some cases completely avoid, tax on capital gains.

Park Medi World IPO: Check allotment status as GMP falls to its lowestPark Medi World IPO closed with an overall subscription of 8.52 times, showing steady demand across categories even as premium expectations cooled.

New labour codes: Will variable pay change your salary, PF and gratuity?Will your take-home salary change under the new labour codes, and what will higher variable pay mean for your PF and gratuity in the long run? Let's understand.

Goa fire tragedy: From compensation to insurance, what victims can claimThe Uphaar cinema fire in Delhi, the Kumbakonam school blaze, the Mumbai Kamala Mills fire, the Surat coaching centre tragedy, each incident left behind not just casualties, but families pushed into years of legal battles simply to secure basic compensation.

Johnson & Johnson ordered to pay $40 million to 2 women in talc powder caseThe verdict comes as the company faces tens of thousands of similar lawsuits nationwide and after its latest attempt to resolve the litigation through bankruptcy was rejected by US courts.

How is young India really spending money? Hint: It's not gadgets and clothesYoung Indians' spending habits are shifting quickly, and it's no longer about gadgets or new outfits. Here's a closer look at where their money is actually going.

Cabinet clears 100% FDI in insurance: What the new bill means for the sectorThe government says the changes are designed to offer stronger protection to policyholders and bring more players into the market. This could lead to better products, faster claim settlements, and improved customer service.

Aroon Purie rings NSE bell, says it's for next chapter of India, India Today GroupIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie on Friday rang the closing bell at the National Stock Exchange (NSE) to mark the Group's 50-year journey and said it was for the next chapter of India and the India Today Group.

NSE bell we ring today is for next chapter of India, India Today Group: Aroon PurieThe moment symbolised both a milestone for the media group and a nod to India's financial markets, which have grown alongside the Group's own evolution since 1975.

Video: NSE felicitates India Today Group Chairman Aroon Purie on 50-year milestoneNational Stock Exchange (NSE) MD & CEO Ashish Kumar Chauhan on Friday felicitated India Today Group Chairman Aroon Purie as the Group completed 50 years at a ceremony in Mumbai.

entertainment.headline: Mohanlal's Vrusshabha trailer to launch in Kochi on December 16 The trailer of Mohanlal's upcoming film Vrusshabha is set to release in Kochi on December 16. The film is slated to release in theatres on December 25.

Brand Akshaye has finally opened eyes: Ameesha Patel's post amid Dhurandhar success Actor Akshaye Khanna's role in Aditya Dhar's espionage thriller Dhurandhar continues to earn him widespread recognition, with Ameesha Patel praising his contributions and acknowledging his renewed popularity.

Rishab Shetty not okay with people mimicking Daivas: I feel uncomfortable Actor Rishab Shetty expressed unease regarding the on-stage mimicking of Daiva rituals, following criticism directed at Ranveer Singh's performance during the International Film Festival of India in Goa earlier this month. Singh issued an apology after his actions sparked debate about cultural sensitivity in cinematic representations.

Simon Cowell's new boyband's BTS shade invokes ragebait debate A member of Simon Cowell's pre-debut boy group, December 10, sparked massive backlash by calling BTS "terrible" and boasting their own group's future success. The viral moment is being debated as "ragebait," designed to provoke ARMY engagement for quick online visibility.

Stephen Colbert questions Paramount's Warner Bros bid over The Late Show axing Stephen Colbert questioned the cancellation of his show for financial reasons when parent company Paramount bid $108 billion for Warner Bros. He joked the bid, partly funded by Middle Eastern wealth funds, meant the company could afford to "uncancel one of their best shows."

De Do Oscar: Smriti Irani praises Akshaye Khanna's Dhurandhar performance Amid Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar success, actor-politician Smriti Irani praised Akshaye Khanna's role as Rehman Dakait in the film.

My Hero Academia wraps up emotionally as Deku and friends say until next time The popular anime series, My Hero Academia came to a close with its latest episode marking the end of a successful run spread across nine years and 181 episodes including OVA's, split into eight seasons.

Rob Reiner's son Nick arrested in parents' deaths: Reports Hollywood director-actor Rob Reiner and Michele Singer's son, Nick, was arrested in parents' deaths. Reportedly, he is currently in the custody of the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department, with bail set at USD 4 million.

Kriti Sanon responds to criticism of her Tere Ishk Mein's toxic character Actor Kriti Sanon recently spoke about the response to her latest film, Tere Ishk Mein, reacting to comments from audiences who have described her character Mukti as 'toxic' and shared negative sentiments toward the film's portrayal of relationships.

K-pop group EXO to make their long awaited comeback with Reverxe on January 19 EXO officially announced their eighth full album, 'Reverxe', releasing January 19, 2026, with six members: Suho, Chanyeol, DO, Kai, Sehun, and Lay. The comeback follows legal disputes and aims to test the K-pop legacy group's evolving identity and longevity.

Dhurandhar proved Bollywood is alive, destroyed false narratives: Nikitin Dheer Actor Nikitin Dheer backed Aditya Dhar's espionage-thriller 'Dhurandhar', praising the direction and "outstanding performances." He celebrated the movie for defeating "false narratives" and its accurate portrayal of India's geopolitical past, wishing it massive box office success.

Bad Boys director Michael Bay to collaborate with Bhanushali Studios, AR Rahman Hollywood director Michael Bay will creatively collaborate with Bhanushali Studios for an Indian film, marking his debut. The movie will be directed by Anthony D'Souza, featuring music by AR Rahman.

Salute to a true legend: Randeep Hooda's special message for John Cena Actor Randeep Hooda dedicated a post for WWE legend John Cena after he announced his retirement. Hooda is set to share screen space with John in upcoming film Matchbox.

Trouble in Rakshit-Rishab-Raj camp? Kantara actor's new video sparks rift rumours The RRR trio of Sandalwood face speculation of a rift after Rishab Shetty's video omits Raj B Shetty. This hints at changing dynamics amid their individual career paths and film promotions.

Anupam Kher's IndiGo flight gets cancelled, he chooses faith over frustration Anupam Kher shared a calm, philosophical response after his IndiGo flight from Varanasi to Khajuraho was cancelled at the last minute. The incident came amid wider IndiGo flight disruptions affecting several routes. IndiGo later issued a press statement on the flight cancellations.

Dhurandhar craze: Ranjeet dances to FA9LA on his granddaughter's birthday. Watch Veteran actor Ranjeet recently grooved on the viral hit 'FA9LA' that featured in the film 'Dhurandhar'. The video of his dance is from the birthday party of his six-year-old granddaughter, Deeya.

Kritika Kamra: Women are expected to be perfect, we don't allow ourselves to fail Kritika Kamra shares her views on the high expectations women face in society and acting. She highlights the unique female perspective in her latest project and the challenges of balancing work and personal life.

K-pop group ENHYPEN all set for January comeback with 7th EP The Sin: Vanish ENHYPEN will begin 2026 with the release of their seventh EP The Sin: Vanish on January 16, marking their first comeback of the year.

TV actor Anuj Sachdeva alleges attack by society resident over parking dispute Actor Anuj Sachdeva released a video on social media documenting an altercation with a fellow resident in his Goregaon housing complex, alleging physical assault and threats following a dispute over parking and his dog.

general news.headline: Thick toxic haze cripples Delhi: 228 flights cancelled, schools shift onlineA sharp decline in air quality in Delhi on Monday left the city under heavy smog, with the AQI reaching hazardous levels and health experts advising residents to take precautions. Multiple monitoring stations reported 'severe' air quality, and health concerns mounted among locals and tourists alike.

Rob Reiner had Trump Derangement Syndrome, died due to...: US President's shockerEven as Hollywood poured its heart out for Reiner, who appeared in the Leonardo DiCaprio-starrer 'The Wolf of Wall Street' and was best known for directing the all-time romantic classic 'When Harry Met Sally,' Trump stooped to a new low by calling one of his staunchest critics "tortured and struggling" a day after his death.

Bondi shooting, many failures: Australia let off IS shooter, cops froze amid firingThe massacre of 15 people at Sydney's Bondi Beach, where a father-son duo opened fire at people celebrating a Jewish festival, exposes deep flaws in Australia's intelligence and police systems. From the Australian intelligence giving a clean chit to shooter Naveed Akram in 2019 to ignoring antisemitism, and then cops freezing for 20 minutes as the killers rained death, the Bondi shooting has exposed systemic failures.

Video: Nitish Kumar pulls woman's hijab at event, Congress slams 'despicable act'A video showed Nitish Kumar pulling down a doctor's hijab after handing over an appointment letter to her at a Patna event. The video, which is going viral on social media, has sparked widespread outrage.

Died shielding wife: Man who survived Hitler's Holocaust killed by Bondi terroristsAfter surviving the horrors of Adolf Hitler's Holocaust and rebuilding his life in Australia, 87-year-old Alex Kleytman was killed in the terrorist attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach. Kleytman, who was at the beach celebrating Hanukkah with his family, died while protecting his wife as the terrorists opened fire at the Jewish gathering.

Watch: Ukraine hits Russian submarine with underwater drones for the first timeUkrainian officials said the strike hit a key Russian naval asset at Novorossiysk, dealing a major blow to Moscow's Black Sea Fleet and complicating efforts to repair or replace the vessel.

Lashkar handler behind Pahalgam carnage, TRF executed attack: NIA chargesheetThe NIA has chargesheeted seven accused, five suspects and two terror outfits - Pakistan-based Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and The Resistance Front (TRF), in connection with the carnage that claimed 26 lives.

'AQI, AQI' chants greet Rekha Gupta at Messi event in smog-hit DelhiAmid Delhi's worsening air pollution, a section of spectators at the Arun Jaitley Stadium booed Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, chanting 'AQI, AQI' as she stepped on stage to welcome Argentine football icon Lionel Messi.

4 cities, 1 GOAT: Lionel Messi's India tour that had it allLionel Messi's India tour moved through chaos and calm, heartbreak and joy. Across four cities, fans waited, erred, celebrated and found fleeting magic in the presence of football's greatest.

Putin signs key pact on military, logistics support with India into federal lawThe RELOS agreement sets out procedures governing the movement of military formations, warships and military aircraft between Russia and India, as well as the arrangements for providing logistical support to each other's forces.

Video: Army shows Turkey-made Pak drone downed by India during Op SindoorThe Army displayed an intercepted Turkish-made YIHA drone used by Pakistan, which was downed by India during Operation Sindoor, ahead of the 54th Vijay Diwas, which commemorates the 1971 war against Pakistan and leading to the creation of Bangladesh.

Keep Your Little Ones Cozy This Winter with Amazon Everyday EssentialsWhether you're looking to care for little ones or find the perfect gift, this collection of baby and kids' essentials brings together nourishment, comfort, and thoughtful design.

Sai Jadhav breaks 93-year record at Indian Military Academy, becomes first woman officerSai Jadhav from Kolhapur has become the first woman officer to pass out from the Indian Military Academy, the prestigious armed forces institution. The milestone she achieved breaks a 93-year-old record, as no woman before Sai had accomplished this feat since the academy's establishment.

Rob Reiner's son Nick arrested in parents' deaths: ReportsHollywood director-actor Rob Reiner and Michele Singer's son, Nick, was arrested in parents' deaths. Reportedly, he is currently in the custody of the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department, with bail set at USD 4 million.

He grabbed my hand: Woman molested by Rapido rider, robbed off Rs 1,000A 19-year-old Rapido bike taxi rider in Maharashtra's Kalyan was arrested for allegedly molesting a 26-year-old woman and stealing Rs 1,000 from her during a booked ride.

H-1B, H-4 visas prudentially revoked in US amid interview delays in IndiaAmid the mass rescheduling of H-1B visa interviews in India, many US-based temporary work visa holders have reportedly received emails informing them that their visas have been "prudentially revoked". An immigration expert says many previously cleared issues are being re-reviewed.

India Today @ 50 Part 1: Revisiting India's most turbulent decadeIndia Today Group marks its 50th anniversary with a five-part docu-series reflecting on its impactful journey in Indian journalism. The series revisits pivotal moments from 1975 to 1985, highlighting political and cultural shifts that shaped the nation.

Why BJP got a working president, and not a full-time president?Nitin Nabin was named the BJP's working president. BJP was gearing for a new national president with JP Nadda given an extension till June 2024 to see through the general election. But why was Nabin named working, and not national, president of the BJP?

Nuclear device lost in the Himalayas 60 years ago threatens Ganga todayIn 1965, at the height of Cold War anxieties over China's nascent nuclear programme, the CIA and India's Intelligence Bureau launched a covert mission to install a nuclear‑powered listening device high on Nanda Devi. Then the weather turned.

Shashi Tharoor's reaction to viral X thread comparing him with Rahul GandhiLending credence to the now-viral thread, which concludes by describing the Opposition as facing "political decay," Shashi Tharoor wrote, "Thank you for this thoughtful analysis. There has always been more than one tendency in the party; your framing is fair, and reflective of a certain perception of the current reality."
Two desi desserts you grew up with make it to the 100 best in the worldFood guide TasteAtlas has released its annual 100 Best Desserts in the World list, with two Indian dishes earning a spot.

Government likely to repeal MGNREGA, bring new rural employment law: SourcesThe government circulated the Bill, which aims to "establish a rural development framework aligned with the national vision of Viksit Bharat @2047", among the members of the Lok Sabha on Monday.

Kabaddi player shot dead during match; attackers opened fire while asking for selfieA kabaddi player was shot dead by bike-borne assailants during a tournament in Mohali. The victim was attacked when he was approached by the attackers on the pretext of taking a selfie. The Bambiha gang claimed responsibility for the shooting.

How IndiGo crisis reveals a bigger tragedy: Air India not seen as ready solutionWhile lakhs of Indians suffered due to the IndiGo fiasco, not many thought of Air India as the Maharaja in a shining armour that could come to their rescue. Air India, which sucked in much-loved Vistara, is trying to find its feet with a refurbished fleet. But decades of bad memories aren't overwritten overnight. Air India can use this moment to step up and reclaim lost ground.

sports.headline: Gap between SA and NZ series? Play Vijay Hazare, BCCI tells India stars The BCCI has made it compulsory for all senior national players to participate in at least two Vijay Hazare Trophy matches. This move aims to ensure players do not treat domestic cricket as second-class tournaments.

IPL 2026 to begin on March 26, final scheduled for May 31: Report The 2026 edition of the Indian Premier League is likely to begin on March 26, with the final scheduled for May 31. Whether the opening match of the tournament will be played at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium is still under review.

4 cities, 1 GOAT: Lionel Messi's India tour that had it all Lionel Messi's India tour moved through chaos and calm, heartbreak and joy. Across four cities, fans waited, erred, celebrated and found fleeting magic in the presence of football's greatest.

A hobbling body, heart left full: Sunil Chhetri reflects on his Messi moment at Mumbai Sunil Chhetri opens up on meeting Lionel Messi during the Mumbai leg of the GOAT India Tour, revealing how the fan in him won amid injury struggles.

Lionel Messi's parting words to India: I will return, hopefully to play a match Legendary Lionel Messi's tour of India concluded in New Delhi on Monday, December 15. Messi addressed the audience at the Arun Jaitley Stadium and shared a message of love to the fans.

Axar Patel ruled out of remaining IND vs SA T20Is due to illness India all-rounder Axar Patel has been ruled out of the remaining two T20I matches against South Africa due to illness. His absence comes at a crucial time as India finalises the squad for the 2026 T20 World Cup.

Anant Ambani to host Lionel Messi and co at Vantara after Delhi trip: Report Lionel Messi is reportedly set for a one-night stop at Vantara, the wildlife rescue centre in Jamnagar, where Anant Ambani will host the football star as part of the GOAT India Tour.

Tim Seifert warms up for IPL 2026 auction with 53-ball century in BBL Tim Seifert warmed up for the IPL 2026 auction in style by smashing a 56-ball century for Melbourne Renegades against Brisbane Heat, powering a 14-run BBL win and earning Player of the Match honours.

Messi's GOAT Tour: Meets Minerva academy, Jay Shah gifts World Cup ticket in Delhi Lionel Messi's GOAT tour in India: Lionel Messi's final stop of the GOAT tour in Delhi was short but electric, with roaring crowds, smiling youngsters and a heartfelt goodbye that brought the GOAT India Tour to a memorable close.

Jay Shah gifts Lionel Messi India vs USA T20 World Cup 2026 ticket in New Delhi Jay Shah gifted Lionel Messi a ticket for the India vs USA match at the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 during a special New Delhi interaction, highlighting a symbolic crossover between global football and Indian cricket.

Shaheen Afridi makes horror BBL debut, removed from attack for dangerous bowling Shaheen Shah Afridi suffered a nightmare BBL debut, being taken off for dangerous bowling during the Brisbane Heat vs Melbourne Renegades clash on Monday at Simonds Stadium in Geelong.

Messi in India: Abhinav Bindra questions focus on individuals over sports cultureOlympic champion Abhinav Bindra has shared thoughtful reflections on Lionel Messi's GOAT India Tour, questioning the spectacle around fleeting access to icons and urging greater investment in grassroots sport across the country.

Arshdeep Singh creates pressure from other end, like bowling with him: HarshitIndia's seam-bowling all-rounder Harshit Rana said he relishes sharing the new ball with Arshdeep Singh, crediting the left-arm pacer for consistently building pressure from the opposite end.

Simon Harmer named ICC Men's Player of the Month after incredible India Test tourSouth Africa's off-spinner Simon Harmer was named ICC Men's Player of the Month for November after a dominant Test series against India, taking 17 wickets at an average of 8.94 and earning Player of the Series honours.

With the Ashes on the line, England's Harry Brook accepts he must curb aggressionThe Ashes 2025-26: Speaking ahead of the third Test in Adelaide, England's Harry Brook admitted that his shot-selection in his first tour Down Under have not been ideal and said that he has to cut down on his aggression while batting.

Shafali Verma named ICC Women's Player of the Month after World Cup heistShafali Verma was named ICC Women's Player of the Month for November 2025 after a match-winning all-round performance in India's World Cup final triumph over South Africa.

Keep this shot in cold storage: Sunil Gavaskar's blunt advice to SuryakumarFormer India captain Sunil Gavaskar was blunt in his assessment, urging Suryakumar Yadav to put his pick-up shot in "cold storage" until he finds the right moment to bring it back.

PSL 2026 to start on March 26, confirms PCB chief, again set to clash with IPLThe PCB has confirmed that PSL 11 will run from March 26 to May 3, overlapping with the IPL, prompting schedule adjustments, a January 8 auction for two new franchises, and paving the way for an eight-team league in 2026.

Who is Deepesh Devendran? Dale Steyn fan wrecks Pakistan in U19 Asia CupDeepesh Devendran continued his rapid rise by ripping through Pakistan with 3/16 in the U19 Asia Cup clash on Sunday in Dubai, underlining his emergence as India's standout fast-bowling prospect.

Desperate England rope in 6'4" speedster for must-win Adelaide TestEngland recalled Josh Tongue for the must-win third Ashes Test in Adelaide, backing the in-form pacer while retaining Ollie Pope and Will Jacks as they look to end a long winless run in Australia.

PM Modi congratulates Indian squash team on historic maiden World Cup winPrime Minister Narendra Modi praised the Indian squash team for their historic maiden Squash World Cup title, saying that the title triumph has made the entire nation proud.

IPL 2026 auction: Six uncapped stars franchises could targetIPL 2026 auction: Uncapped stars to watch – explosive batters, versatile all-rounders and promising young bowlers who could become breakout sensations or bargain buys for franchises

Messi in India Highlights: Next stop Vantara after Delhi-leg of GOAT tourMessi in India, GOAT tour Day 3 Highlights: Lionel Messi has finally arrived at the Arun Jaitley stadium, and he met with the Minerva Academy's young stars for a quick photo-op.

New Zealand pacer Blair Tickner set to miss white-ball tour of IndiaBlair Tickner is likely to miss New Zealand's five-match ODI and three-match T20I series in India, beginning on January 11, after dislocating his shoulder during the second Test against the West Indies.

'Are your lungs insured Messi?' Fans prepare to welcome GOAT in smoggy DelhiAs Lionel Messi nears to his arrival in fog-hit New Delhi, fans chose humour over chaos. Memes flooded social media, capturing the capital's weather, pollution and anticipation around the football icon's final India stop.

Australia captain Pat Cummins calls for blood donations after Bondi Beach attackAustralian cricket team captain Pat Cummins has issued an urgent appeal for blood donations following Sunday's deadly attack at Bondi Beach, which claimed 16 lives and left dozens injured.

Messi in New Delhi: Traffic police set new rules to avoid a Kolkata-like messDelhi authorities have moved early to prevent crowd chaos as Lionel Messi's India tour reaches its final stop. After the Kolkata fallout, tighter traffic planning aims to ensure smoother movement and safer fan access.

Ashes: England coach issues clarification over viral 'overprepared' statementEngland head coach Brendon McCullum said his post-Brisbane "overprepared" comment was meant to protect the dressing room and that internal messages can sound different in public.

A 14-year-old at the door: Why Vaibhav Suryavanshi feels ready for India debutAt an age when most are still learning the game, Vaibhav Suryavanshi is forcing Indian cricket to confront an uncomfortable question: when talent arrives this early, can patience afford to wait?

IPL 2026 auction strategy explained: 5 players SRH can targetIPL Auction: SunRisers Hyderabad finished 6th in the last edition of the IPL. The team will be looking out for a specialist finisher and a couple of strong spin bowling options.

Shubman, Suryakumar will win matches for India at T20 World Cup: AbhishekIndia opener Abhishek Sharma has thrown his weight behind senior batters Suryakumar Yadav and Shubman Gill ahead of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, expressing confidence that the duo will come good when it matters most.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
